title: Spellforged servitor (monster)
data: {{version030}} ''This page covers the construct. For the spell, see [[Spellforged Servitor]]. For a list of all constructs, see [[list of constructs]].'' {{monster info|Spellforged servitor|Spellforged servitor (monster)}} ==Useful Info== '''Spellforged servitors''' are obedient magical [[list of constructs|constructs]] created by the spell, [[Spellforged Servitor]]. These beings come into existence able to cast [[Conjurations|destructive]] spells known by its summoner. For players, the servitor will have a single spell. For monsters, the servitor can cast any valid spell in the monster's spell set. Refer to the [[Spellforged Servitor|spell's article]] for details on which spells are valid. ===Details=== When cast by the spell, servitors have 60 + 7d5 (67 - 95) HP, instead of the amount listed in the infobox. Servitors cast slowly. Player-summoned servitors have a ~75% chance to cast a spell every 1.8 [[decaAut]]. For monster servitors, it has a ~33% chance to cast a spell every 1.8 decaAut (chosen randomly; favoring higher level spells).{{source ref|0.30.0|spl-summoning.cc|1546}} ==Tips & Tricks== *Spellforged servitors can wield awesome destructive powers when conjured up by a powerful combat mage, while casters who know only weak spells will not get nearly as much use out of them. *Although they don't have much in the way of HP or defenses, spellforged servitors are extremely resistant to most elements, making them capable of standing their ground against very powerful late-game foes. ==History== Spellforged servitors were added in [[0.14]]. ==References==
